channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Lean4: How the theorem prover works and why it's the new competitive edge in AI
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have astounded the world with their capabilities, yet they remain plagued by unpredictability and hallucinations – confidently outputting incorrect information. In high-stakes domains like finance, medicine or autonomous systems, such unreliability is unacceptable. Enter Lean4, an open-source programming language and interactive theorem prover becoming a key tool to inject rigor and certainty into AI systems. By leveraging formal verification, Lean4 promises to make AI safer, more secure and deterministic in its functionality. Let's explore how Lean4 is being adopt...

item.title: How to watch British Christmas TV 2025 from anywhere – UK Xmas TV schedule, free streams
item.description: How to watch British Christmas TV 2025 from abroad with a VPN, including marquee specials The Room in the Tower, The War Between the Land and the Sea and Dear Father Christmas.

item.title: Sorry American 3D printing fans - Bambu Lab has a mighty new seven-nozzle printer, but you won't be able to get it anytime soon
item.description: Bambu Labs H2C introduces a magnetic seven-nozzle system with improved purge handling, reduced bed size, higher costs -but there's no US release yet.

item.title: Trump administration might not fight state AI regulations after all

item.title: Waymo gets regulatory approval to expand across Bay Area and Southern California
item.description: Waymo continues to expand its reach, with the robotaxi company posting Friday that it’s now “officially authorized to drive fully autonomously across more of the Golden State.”

item.title: California Just Legalized Waymo in Some of the Nation’s Most Populous Areas
